column5: I gotta get up there one of these years. :-).   That is indeed a monster.   Congrats to the angler.
Nice fish. If you read carefully, this one was 54 as well...  Almost 55". I missed that.
Holy crap!
What a beast!
Clearly no where near the end I fish........

I heard a rumor yesterday that it was caught by Brown Island at the mouth of the French , but again I heard a rumor , also a local guy claims to have landed a 59' weighing in at 56lbs .( no photo)  dead camera batteries , but I do believe that Nipissing may be harboring a WR fish .  Randy
but I do believe that Nipissing may be harboring a WR fish .    I think there's about 7 lakes listed that could hold the new WR and Nippissing is definitely one of them.
nip, low, lac seul, ottawa, larry, can't remember if there another.  nip sure can do it!
Lower manitou holds some beasts.
nip, low, lac seul, ottawa, larry, can't remember if there another.  nip sure can do it!  Seems to me Eagle Lake is on the list.
which eagle lake?  The one with the giant muskies
bet it comes from an anglers boat from Montreal. Many hard core late seasoners here. Some near misses too.
We'll find out if I get up there next year. :-)
smarta** lol. Well now that narrows it down to 20 or so lakes haha  Let's go with the one west of Dryden LOL
How about those two small little lakes Georgian bay, and lake Erie? you think it might hold a world record?
Erie, possible, but not likely
Georgian bay 100% Erie, possible, but not likely  hard to argue with any of the great lakes, a belly full of bullheads and a 4" rapala.
that is an incredible musky. shes a monster
There have been several big muskies over 60lbs taken from the Ottawa/st. Lawrence rivers in the last few years !!! And my bet that's where the most potential lies for a shot at the world record !!!
Really. Show me one.

I saw shown a picture this past summer of a angler who caught a 54" on the Murray Canal at the mouth of Presqu'ile Bay. So I'm sure there are some beasts there also.  But still 55"  beast is awesome, I can't even catch a small musky lol.
what a beast
Just seen this pic on fb a big girl caught and released on lake nip !!!!
where's the fish? did you attach the wrong photo?
Ya wrong pic I got it now I think !!!
Ya wrong pic I got it now I think !!! You sure did !!WOW!!!!!
First? WOW  Nice fish
absolutely massive wow
Ya it was only caught a few days ago too !!! She is a big girl for sure !!!!
My buddy (clients) has boated 100s of muskie on Nipissing including over 60 this year. I believe he has yet to get a 55"! He has a few that were 54+" but 55" and up have eluded him.
awesome fish!!!
Yeah, that's a real beaut, thanks for posting that Shawn !!  No wonder I love fishing Nip so much
First muskie?  Time to retire from muskie fishing!!
That's a beast....
SUPERTANKER!!
Wow what a fat beast!!! Good on them for releasing the big brute. If I was to land such a behemoth I probably wouldn't be so inclined to do so...
Wow, thanks for posting Shawn.  I know they're in there, ya just gotta find them
Totally awesome musky for sure
So why the heck do I only fish for walleye on that lake...........?!?!?!?!
Wow... where is that original report from????
I wonder which end of the lake it was?

I wonder which end of the lake it was? Bernie it was from the other end no matter which side you fished. lol Nice fish I have fished the Nipissing for 10 years and skunked a few muskie pro's. I am still the king of not catching a muskie.   Art
Bernie it was from the other end no matter which side you fished. lol  Art, now that's funny.
LOL Art!I bet it was at my end
No Bernie, I recognise that tree there, and it is definitely the other side of the lake.
Wow! Man that is huge! First fish!! Crazy!  Thanks, for sharing!
Nice fish. If you read carefully, this one was 54 as well...
